summary: This bill, S.1959, aims to protect integrity, fairness, and objectivity in decisions regarding access to classified information. It mandates exclusivity, consistency, and transparency in security clearance procedures. It establishes a right to appeal for individuals denied or revoked access to classified information, including agency review panels and a higher-level review by a Security Executive Agent. The bill also specifies conditions for review, access to documents, and publication of decisions, as well as preserving existing processes under Executive Order 10865.
